body.p: This procedure checks a device or filesytem for labels on its partitions.
body.section:
Check a Device for Partition Labels
To check whether a device has labels on a partition, log on to the serverand use the parted command as follows:sudo parted -lThe output lists all of the block devices. Following is an example output for /dev/sdc. with a single partition. Note the label, which appears in the Name column as c0a8f502h000. Model: QEMU QEMU HARDDISK (scsi) Disk /dev/sdc: 20.0GB Sector size (logical/physical): 512B/512B Partition Table: gpt Disk Flags:
Number Start End Size File system Name Flags 1 1049kB 20.0GB 20.0GB xfs c0a8f502h000

section.title: Check a Filesytem for Partition Labels
section.p: To check whether a filesystem has labels on a partition, log on to the server and execute the xfs_admin command.
In this example, /dev/sdc1 is the partition where the filesystem is located.

ul.li: If the filesystem exists and has a label, the result is:label = "c0a8f502h000"
If the filesystem does not have a label, the result is: need code here
If the filesystem does not exist, the result is:xfs_admin: /dev/sde is not a valid XFS filesystem (unexpected SB magic number 0x00000000)
